newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore sees trade growing just five pct in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Singapore sees trade growing just five pct in 1996.

text.p: Singapore's external trade is expected to grow by five percent in 1996, down from 13.2 percent in 1995, the head of the Trade Development Board was quoted as saying.
Monday's Straits Times newspaper quoted Barry Desker as saying in an interview:
"Except for oil exports, we expect the other major trade components to remain flat in the fourth quarter of 1996."
Exports were being squeezed by flat global demand for electronics and lower re-exports to Malaysia, Desker said.
He said trade performance in the first half of 1997 was also likely to remain flat, picking up only in the second half.

"So far, the signals are mixed. If the global electronics industry recovers in line with market expectations, we should see some improvement in the trade figures by the second half of 1997," Desker said.
